comment_body: nit: On the first read of comment, I felt we are setting it for only first request. But DeltaDiscoveryRequest has this field populated only on first request on reconnection.
author: ramaraochavali

comment_body: nit: prefer to use a ticker or time.after so we can get cancelled by the context.
author: howardjohn

comment_body: Unfortunately, -executable is not on the MacOS find. `find . -type f \( -perm -u=x -o -perm -g=x -o -perm -o=x \) -exec test -x {} \; -print` seems like it works. Only use this on `darwin`? Not sure of the best negation of this since we probably don't want to run `test` on all of those marked none executable.
author: ericvn

comment_body:
@yrobla :
firstly: thanks for this change !
However, affinity and toleration are not defined in values.yaml ( https://github.com/istio/istio/blob/master/manifests/charts/istio-control/istio-discovery/values.yaml ), so they can't be used yet
=> would you be able to add them there as well ?
(let me know if you need a new issue for this )

Thanks again
author: jgournet

comment_body: The [crash](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=43889#c3) was discovered by [OSS-Fuzz](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/tree/master/projects) with the new [Code Intelligence](https://www.code-intelligence.com/) go instrumentation feature. We see a risk for a denial of service by the vulnerability in multiple target applications that are using itsio version < **1.11.6**/**1.12.3**/**1.13.0**. We would like to assign a CVE for this, if you haven't already assigned one. @howardjohn did you already publish a security advisory or assign a CVE for the vulnerability?
author: 0roman

comment_body: Please follow SECURITY.md in the repo and responsibly discuss this in private.
author: howardjohn

comment_body: @howardjohn this bug has been fixed and it has been opened to the public already, but we can discuss this in private.
author: 0roman
